urls.title: Why 2020 has been good for England's beavers
urls.description: Homes for these "ultimate environmental engineers" have been set up in enclosures across England.

tweets.text:
2020 has been a good year for beavers in England! The canals and dams beavers build alleviate flood risk and create wetlands for other species. 

400 years ago they were hunted to extinction, find out about the successes we've seen in their reintroduction: https://t.co/JSWh5o63Kd

Even when it‚Äôs rainin‚Äô, we keep on trainin‚Äô. #ADCP #Riverflow measurement training for @EnvAgencySE hydrometry teams. Vital skills to manage this summer‚Äôs ‚Äò#flought‚Äô (2012 again...?) Hope not! https://t.co/96AQ0vlLnZ

In our joint #NewYear2021 message, ‚Å¶@TonyJuniper‚Å© @NaturalEngland @WilliamWorsley @ForestryEngland & I say: this must be the year we ramp up action to tackle #naturerecovery & #climatechange #TogetherForOurPlanet @cop26 @envagency @DefraGovUK #COP26 https://t.co/lTPGTQx4FX

tweets.text: @ilkleyIain @EmmaHowardBoyd @NaturalEngland @williamworsley @ForestryEngland @COP26 @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK That is indeed a key policy, & one that is now fully in development. If we can get the synergy between food, Nature & carbon right, that will be a huge contribution.
@Imogen221 @HpoolCouncil @HPoolMail @EnvAgency Bad shit that!

@EmmaHowardBoyd @TonyJuniper @NaturalEngland @williamworsley @ForestryEngland @COP26 @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK Sounds good just hope the work farmers do to contribute to the  objective is recognised & rewarded at market value & not undervalued. 
If it is that important and ‚Äúthe year we ramp up action‚Äù, then the incentive must be there. Fail to do  so then it will be an uphill struggle.

For the last couple of weeks petrol / diesel has been pouring into the Yare up stream of Marston Marshes @EnvAgencyAnglia.
-
I thought the floods might have carried it away for good but sadly something is still leaking badly into this local ecosystem. @NorfolkWT @EnvAgency https://t.co/3LrJ4tu0QH

@DunkinWedd @Evansthegrump @RosieP4 @shaun_boughton @HS2theTruth @greenarteries @EnvAgencySE @AnglianWater @LV8andrea @chrismothman1 @MarkAlanCory @HomesEngland It's time they did. It's like a plague spread by developers aided by government policy that is spreading the length and breadth of our beautiful country.

Stay away from flooded rivers and check your #flood risk: https://t.co/BpUpnjiX4L https://t.co/pM9TXGKiRI

We want this music to our ears all year round please Affinity @AquiferChalk @EnvAgency @AffinityWater @OliverHealdUK https://t.co/ue3HRB85FC

urls.title: Report an environmental incident
urls.description: How to report environmental incidents, including pollution

tweets.text: @rich_mitch @EnvAgencyAnglia @NorfolkWT @EnvAgency That's awful. You can report it via: https://t.co/7ngCQIu0QK Incident hotline: Telephone: 0800 80 70 60

We would like to thank all our staff who have worked tirelessly over their Christmas break responding to the recent major flooding incident. üëç

We're also grateful to all our partners for their co-operation and help with incident response. ü§ù

Wishing you all a happy new year!

tweets.text: @EdenSwimmer @NECumbria @EnvAgency I would say it is a very good sign to find  3 dead, esp if you haven‚Äôt seen them there before. I think C 80% die post spawning (and almost all males, as the one with protracted lower jaw/kipe certainly is). Size suggests good growth/abundant feed (at sea) contrary to many trends.

A convicted #WasteCrime offender has been ordered to pay ¬£2.1 million.

He had dumped, buried or burned waste totalling about 25,000 cubic metres.

This is one of the highest penalties issued following one of our investigations.

Read more: https://t.co/xWok42h24W https://t.co/j4Tac7rGoc

All,

I can confirm the River is open to navigation for essential travel,  and all locks are open  on hand wind only with the exception of Cookham and Hambledon .We do not encourage navigation whilst the River is on Red boards.@MarkHill03 @wifo_ea @EnvAgencySE https://t.co/TRsEqJjCZX
